Extract model coefficients

Source: R/PLNfit-S3methods.R
coef.PLNfit.Rd

Extracts model coefficients from objects returned by PLN() and its variants

# S3 method for class 'PLNfit'
coef(object, type = c("main", "covariance"), ...)

Arguments

object

an R6 object with class PLNfit

type

type of parameter that should be extracted. Either "main" (default) for $$B$$ or "covariance" for $$\Sigma$$

...

additional parameters for S3 compatibility. Not used

Value

A matrix of coefficients extracted from the PLNfit model.

See also

sigma.PLNfit(), vcov.PLNfit(), standard_error.PLNfit()

Examples

data(trichoptera)
trichoptera <- prepare_data(trichoptera$Abundance, trichoptera$Covariate)
myPLN <- PLN(Abundance ~ 1 + offset(log(Offset)), data = trichoptera)
#> 
#>  Initialization...
#>  Adjusting a full covariance PLN model with nlopt optimizer
#>  Post-treatments...
#>  DONE!
coef(myPLN) ## B
#>                   Che       Hyc       Hym       Hys        Psy       Aga
#> (Intercept) -8.180929 -8.277718 -2.982273 -7.087495 -0.5456757 -4.087154
#>                   Glo       Ath       Cea      Ced       Set       All
#> (Intercept) -6.338142 -6.046257 -7.121505 -3.63979 -4.399302 -4.923586
#>                   Han       Hfo       Hsp       Hve       Sta
#> (Intercept) -4.813183 -6.128817 -4.212557 -6.850112 -2.886673
coef(myPLN, type = "covariance") ## Sigma
#>              Che          Hyc         Hym         Hys           Psy
